Uses of Class
popt4jlib.MSSC1D.Params

  • Packages that use Params 
    Package Description
    popt4jlib.MSSC1D
    Package implements a Parallel Dynamic-Programming (DP) - based algorithm for clustering in a Minimum-Sum-of-Square-Error-Distances a sequence of numbers.

    • Uses of Params in popt4jlib.MSSC1D

      Fields in popt4jlib.MSSC1D declared as Params 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) Params SolverAux._p 
      (package private) Params SolverAuxMat._p 
      private Params Solver._params 
      Methods in popt4jlib.MSSC1D with parameters of type Params 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private double Cluster.avg(Params p) 
      double Cluster.evaluate(Params p)
      evaluate the MSSC value of this cluster according to the distance metric specified in the input Params object.
      double ClusterSet.evaluate(Params p)
      evaluate the clustering represented by this object according to the data and parameters specified in the input Params argument.
      double ClusterSet.evaluate(Params p, boolean allow_partial)
      evaluate the clustering represented by this object according to the data and parameters specified in the input Params argument p, allowing partial evaluation if the second argument is true.
      double Cluster.evaluateWF(Params p)
      method acts as the evaluate(p) method, but first also checks for feasibility of the cluster, and if found infeasible, returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY.
      boolean Cluster.isFeasible(Params p)
      check if this cluster is feasible according to the sum-of-intra-distance values from the center of the cluster constraint whose threshold value is found in the input Params argument.
      private double[][] Solver.makeAllClustersMatrix_L2(Params p)
      return the matrix of dimensions n X n where [i,j] denotes the cost of the cluster containing the contiguous values of indices [i, i+1, ..., j] computed for L2 norm, only, allowing the overall MSSC1D DP-algorithm based on DP to achieve complexity O(kn^2/E) where k is the number of clusters sought and E the number of available processing units.
      private double[][] Solver.makeAllClustersMatrix(Params p)
      return the matrix of dimensions n X n where [i,j] denotes the cost of the cluster containing the contiguous values of indices [i, i+1, ..., j].
      private double Cluster.sum(Params p) 
      java.lang.String ClusterSet.toString(Params p)
      return a String representation of this ClusterSet as follows: [(val_1,...val_i),...(val_j,...val_n)] where the vals are the real values of the data sequence in p.
